events.summary: Juan returns to Toledo from the Cortes. Reunion with Isabel who is 8+ months pregnant. He doffs his armor symbolically, promising to stay until the baby is born.

exchanges.text: I hold her and help her into a chair. The Cortes went well.
Isabel relieved. Juan stays with her through the waiting weeks.

events.summary: Birth of Princess Catalina. Roll 11 — Severe Birth Crisis. Breech presentation, 24+ hours of labor, hemorrhaging. Roll 45 — daughter. Roll 96 — baby miraculously healthy. Roll 39 — Isabel develops moderate infection, difficult recovery. Juan stays by her side as she battles fever and infection.

exchanges.text: Roll for how the birth goes.
Roll 11 — Severe crisis. Roll 45 — girl. Roll 96 — baby healthy. Roll 39 — Isabel infection.

events.summary: Three excommunicated nobles respond to Crown Marshal summons. Roll 9 — Sotomayor: Fortified Defiance, barricaded. Roll 56 — Baron de Medina: Reluctant Compliance. Roll 21 — Second noble: Defiant Refusal. Roll 6 — Count of Niebla: Violent Defiance. Two in open rebellion. Marshals dispatched with final demands.

exchanges.text: Sotomayor defiant. Baron compliant. Second defiant. Niebla violent.
Send the marshals. Give them one last chance.

events.summary: Letter from King João I of Portugal. Juan furiously agrees to let Isabel's mother come. Dictates letter requesting Portuguese physicians too. Visits Isabel, tells her mother is coming. They spend time with baby Catalina.

exchanges.text: To hell with that! She needs her mother!
Letter sent. Juan visits Isabel, tells her mother is coming.
